intro: Actinostemma multilobum, commonly known as the mountain pimpernel, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and often edible plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
